New Records: The Rays finished 1-for-9 with runners in scoring position on the night, dropping their season average with RISP to an MLB-worst.214, which would be the lowest full-season average with RISP in club history, below the 2011 club mark of.224 -- and the fifth-lowest mark by any team since play-by-play data became available in 1969.
Key Match Events: Shane Baz retired each of the final 12 hitters he faced
Weston Wilson hit a ball right in front of the plate that allowed the winning run to score
Drew Rasmussen walked Castellanos with two outs and gave up a single to Brandon Marsh that advanced Castellanos to third
Post-Match Reflections: Taylor Walls said, 'I feel like that's kind of how it's been for a majority of the season, at least. I feel like there's a lot of ballgames that we feel like we should win... and it just seems like we're coming up short a little more than we are coming through.'
Rasmussen said, 'We were definitely competitive â€¦ [against] the best team in baseball. We're not too far off, right?'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rays pitched well enough to beat the team with the best record in baseball
The Rays scored twice against Wheeler on Walls' second-inning RBI single and Aranda's sixth-inning home run
The Rays' loss marked their sixth sweep of the season
Others: The Rays are now seven games out of the final American League Wild Card spot as they head to Cleveland to face the Guardians, who are tied with the Yankees for the AL's best record.
